data.title: My Favorite Place for Breakfast
data.text:
I've been going to the Farm House for over 20 yrs. and can honestly say I have never had bad service or a bad meal. They feed you fast and you will be full when you leave. Atmosphere for old town Gilbert is perfect.

Breakfast is awesome but you need to get there early to get your name on the list. It usually doesn't take very long but there is always a wait if you're there after 8. I always get one of the specials on the board and have never been disappointed. If you like cinnamon rolls, its is as big as the plate and right out of the oven so plan on sharing.

Lunch is also great. It's all "comfort food". Try the pot roast or meatloaf w/ mashed potatoes and gravy. They have awesome dinner rolls.

You can't go wrong eating here.

data.title: Best breakfast in town
data.text: Great breakfast food with friendly service. They accommodate allergies which is a must for my family. You will probably have a wait so be prepared.

data.title: just average at best
data.text: My wife and I stopped in for breakfast and had a table out on the patio. the customer service was excellent but the food was average. I ordered scrambled eggs with sausage, hash browns and whole grain toast. The eggs and potatoes must have been cooked with lots and lots of butter. the tasted stayed with me for hours. I would order something different in a future visit.

data.title: Wonderful breakfast!
data.text: If you want an amazing omelet, don't look any further.  Also, don't let the long lines deter you from putting your name on the waiting list.  This place is efficient and moves people in and out in an expedient manner.  The breakfast food is fantastic.  I don't, however, recommend this place for large groups because the place is very small.  Best for a couple or small group.  Yum!

data.title: Average
data.text: This was an average meal. Nothing too amazing. It was not bad by any means, but not worth sitting outside in the sun for 45 minutes as we waited for a table. Service was nice and food was ok.

data.title: Excellent breakfast food.
data.text: There's a reason why the Farmhouse has a long line outside. They take breakfast seriously and they do it very well. They make their bread fresh and it's quite tasty. The food is down home cooking style. They don't add weird sauces or anything unusual to the menu but what they do is make it good and at a great price. They offer a quaint atmosphere as well. I don't recommend going with large groups of people because the inside is quite small, but it's fun for groups of 4 to 6. Try it during the week if you're available. The weekends can have quite long lines.

data.title: Mixed Bag
data.text: Went for breakfast with family. There were ten of us on a Sunday morning. The hostess acted really annoyed with the group. We showed up early to get on the list. I know they were busy and didn't need the customers but first impressions mean a lot. They did get us in. The wait wasn't even that bad - just the attitude. The food was pretty good - omelets, chicken fried steak and cinnamon rolls. No one was disappointed, no one was thrilled. Quality breakfast standards.

data.title: One of my favorites!
data.text: This place is the real deal. I have a tough time deciding because they have it all. Love the omelettes, love the pancakes and I'm not usually too into them elsewhere. They serve really nice bread with their breakfasts too. Sourdough is my favorite. Hot sandwiches, cinnamon rolls, tasty iced tea. Great place for families or meeting a friend. I was there recently with my coworkers for a nice lunch.

data.title: Big Portions
data.text: Big portions.Tasty food. A nice eatery for an antique-ing day in Gilbert! Try the pancakes and good coffee too!!

data.title: Terrific Value!
data.text:
This diminutive, quaint restaurant offers a broad menu of down-home diner fare. The rustic ambiance fits in well with the old-west charm of ever-improving old downtown Gilbert.

The build-your-own omelet options were plentiful and the portions were generous. The Reuben Sandwich was delicious, and featured perhaps the leanest pastrami that I have ever eaten.

For $5.50 a large goblet of sparkling, with grapefruit juice on the side, made two very perfect mimosas!

The most outstanding feature of Farm House is the highly attentive and accommodating kitchen and wait staffs. We had a few rather particular (or peculiar :-) requests which were immediately fulfilled without so much as a shrug.

This was our first visit, and it certainly will not be our last.

data.title: Old style breakfast at lunch time
data.text: Get ready for waiting, there are some benches and a wait list. It is worth it, a very satisfying breakfast with good everything (bacon, pancakes and more).

data.title: Great Breakfasts!
data.text: Be prepared to wait in line for breakfast unless you are very early.  The Farm House is that good and not to be missed.  Fantastic hot cakes and really great sweet rolls

data.title: Still the best breakfast in Gilbert
data.text: The Farmhouse has been our go-to breakfast place for years. Excellent service, home-style cooking, and great atmosphere all come together to make this place what it is. Consider yourself lucky if you're able to just walk in (you must have gotten there at 6 am!), but the wait is always worthwhile. Highly recommended.

data.title: WOW - wish I could eat here every morning!
data.text: This is our favorite breakfast spot!! Usually there is a huge line of people waiting, so plan to wait. Everything our family has tried here, we have loved. Very wholesome, classic dishes that do not disappoint. I also love the brunch drinks...try the Morning Glory or Hibiscus!

data.title: Great place
data.text: Really good food and nice outdoor dining area. Had lunch there and dinner another night. Seems to be very popular with the locals and pleased we happened on to it.

data.title: Huge portions!
data.text: Yum! Get there early or plan to wait a bit for a table. Our family of 5 wanted breakfast before our long drive to the Grand Canyon so we did some Trip Advisor research and chose Farm House. The portions are big so plan for kids to share. We ordered omelets, pancakes and waffles and no one was disappointed.

data.title: Quaint setting, delicious farm to table food
data.text: Took the family for supper here. We sat outside on the pic is tables and enjoyed the evening. Food was quite good. I liked the many side options available to go with your burger other than the standard fries or basic salad. After you eat you can stroll over to the market stand and buy some fresh greens or fruits and veggies. Then hit up the coffee shop for an amazing cupcake and after dinner coffee! Great way to spend an evening

data.title: Yummy Baked Walnut Granola
data.text: Small restaurant with great service and good food.   There is a small bench outside while you wait for a table.  It's a very busy restaurant.   I had the Baked Walnut Granola with strawberries and yogurt, DELICIOUS.   We also ordered the eggs tacos with chorizo, another great choice.   Coffee is very smooth tasting.  Every waitress helps each other out.  Great teamwork.  Parking is available behind the restaurant.  A return, a must.

data.title: Awesome breakfast!
data.text: Great place for breakfast not very large so probably better for smaller groups so seating could be an issue service was fantastic

data.title: My new favorite in Gilbert
data.text:
This is definitely my new favorite breakfast place in the valley!  Excellent coffee (the Farmhouse blend from Perky's Coffee shop across the street), ginormous #5 omelette (ham, bacon, tomato & cheese), homefries and toasted French bread.  My wife had her favorite, French toast, but honestly I was too busy scarfing down my delicious breakfast to notice.  Pretty sure her plate was empty when we left!
The staff here is high-motor and in constant motion.  Will definitely go again when we are in Gilbert area again...maybe two or three times.
